task.title: Place Typewriter Back Into Case
task.shortdesc: The typewriter must be placed into its case to protect it from dust, physical damage, moisture, and accidental impact while also making it safer and easier to store or transport

step.cmd: Center the carriage of the typewriter.
Pick up the typewriter and tilt it's front end upwards approximately 2 to 3 inches.
Slowly insert the typewriter into the case. Ensure the two slots on the back of the typewriter slide into the double-pronged cleat at the back of the case.
Push the front of the typewriter down so that it latches onto the front cleat.
Check to ensure that the typewriter is secure by lifting its front end. If it is secure, it will not lift from the case.
